resource.name: General Parcel Locations with Land Use Codes
resource.description: A subset of Riverside County Assessor Property Tax information that contains a field called 'Real Use Code'. The Real Use Code describes how the property is utilized - Residential, Commercial or Agricultural and provides additional attributes such as 'CA' = Apartment building, 'CR' = Residential use on Commercially zoned property, or 'R2' = Residential with 2 to 3 units. A guide call 'Real Use Codes' is published as a reference document for this dataset.
columns_description: Physical City Location

The purpose of the Use Code is to identify the primary activity for which the parcel is
being used.  The use
code does not necessarily reflect the parcel’s present zoning. Refer the the attached 'RealUseCodes.pdf'.
Physical Street Location Direction
Physical building or house number
Physical Location Zip Code
R, M, T & Y = Residential; C= Commercial; A & P = Agricultural.  Refer to the attached 'RealUseCodes.pdf'
Physical Street Location
Associated with the Primary Use Type Codes of R, M, T & Y = Residential; C= Commercial; A & P = Agricultural.  Refer to the attached 'RealUseCodes.pdf'
The number of units at the SITUS location.
Physical Street Address Number
Physical Street Location Suffix

resource.name: Ambulance Patient Offload Delay Data, 2012 to Present
resource.description: This data is collected from the dispatch data of Riverside County's primary contracted 9-1-1 medical response provider, American Medical Response (AMR). It is the interval that ambulance crews and patients are retained past the initial 30 minutes after arrival to the Emergency Department. This data is used to evaluate hospital Emergency Department compliance with the offload standard and evaluate how the impact of offload delays may be affecting the 9-1-1 response system.
columns_name: Feb. Total AMR ALS Ambulance Visits
May Total AMR ALS Ambulance Visits
July Total AMR ALS Ambulance Visits
Jan. Total AMR ALS Ambulance Visits
June Total AMR ALS Ambulance Visits
Dec. Total AMR ALS Ambulance Visits
Mar. Total AMR ALS Ambulance Visits
Nov. Total AMR ALS Ambulance Visits
Aug. Total AMR ALS Ambulance Visits
Sept. Total AMR ALS Ambulance Visits
Apr. Total AMR ALS Ambulance Visits
Oct. Total AMR ALS Ambulance Visits
columns_description: Since 2013, this is the monthly time past an initial thirty minutes that ambulances were held at a hospital awaiting ambulance patient offload. The initial 30 minutes of each patient offload interval are not included in this delay calculation. Before 2013, the standard offload allowance was 25 minutes.

resource.name: Animal Services -- Impound Year To Date (YTD)
resource.description: The information is extracted from the "animal" database through chameleon (shelter application). In accordance with Food & Agriculture Code 32003, all public pounds and shelters shall keep accurate records on each animal impounded that includes the final disposition of the animal. This information is to show current year to date impound trends for each shelter and jurisdiction.

resource.name: Inventory of Parcels Subject to Power of Sale - July 1, 2017
resource.description:
The purpose of a Secured tax sale is to return tax defaulted property back to the tax roll, collect unpaid taxes and convey title to the purchaser. Properties become subject to the County Tax Collector’s power to sell because of a default in the payment of property taxes for five or more years. These properties may be purchased at one of our many online public auctions; there are no tax lien certificates or over the counter sales.
Notes:
1 Based on 2016-2017 Values
2 Redemption Amount as of July, 1 2017, Amount will increase 1 1/2% per month and may or may not include all special assessments

resource.name: Landfill Tonnage by Jurisdiction
resource.description: Total landfilled waste received by each jurisdiction (city) into each active landfill (not inclusive of Rural, non-scaled landfills).  Data is finalized quarterly and available 3.5 months after each quarter.  For example, first quarter data (Jan-Mar) is available June 15th.
columns_name: TWENTY NINE PALMS BAND OF MISSION INDIANS (459)

resource.name: San Jacinto Daily Rainfall - Station 186
resource.description: Daily Rainfall for Station 186 in San Jacinto from 2/1/1940 to 12/31/15. Daily Rainfall is collected by a volunteer observer who reads the gauge everyday at the same time (8AM). In more recent years the data at important record sites is collected by automatic rain gauges. This data is collected to help analyze rainfall totals in specific areas. This supports RCFC's efforts to build adequate facilities which protect the residents of Riverside County.

resource.name: Behavioral Health
resource.description: This data is recorded in the Riverside University Health Systems-BH  electronic health record. The report is an aggregated summary of the unduplicated clients served by RUHS-BH in a Fiscal Year.  The data set is a de-indentified extraction of the unduplicated clients served in a Fiscal Year and includes the characteristics of the population including: age; Race/Ethnicity, Gender, Geographic Region of County (Desert, Western, Mid-County); Education (18-59yr olds); Martial Status; and Primary Diagnosis.
columns_description:
Category Values: Western, Mid-County, Desert
For MH Consumers only: History of Service in Substance Use Department or Substance use co-occurring diagnosis. 
Category Values: Caucasian, Black/African American, Latino, Asian/Pacific Islander, Native American, Other/Unknown.
"Age as of the end of the FY. Category Values: <18, 18-59 yrs, 60+yrs
"
Only collected for MH consumers
Value will be based on year FY ended. For example FY 15/16 will have a 16.
Sub-population of major age groups, true or false if they belong to the transition age group 16-25 years of age.
1=MH (Mental Health); 2=SA (Substance Abuse)
Only collected for SA consumers
Category variables: Male, Female, Unknown
Consumer had Medi-Cal eligibility at least once in the fiscal year.
Random, deidentified ID assigned to replace RUHS-BH client ID
"Category Values: AD/D, Organic, Drug and Alcohol, Schizophrenia/Psychosis, MoodAnxAdjustment, Major Depression, Bi-Polar, Other MH Diagnosis, Amphetamines, Cannabis, Cocaine, Inhalants, Hallucinogen, Opined, Other SA Diagnosis
"

resource.name: System Of Record Inventory - SB272 Published List
resource.description: In accordance with California SB 272, Riverside County provides a list of enterprise systems of record.  These are systems that are used across multiple departments or that contain information collected about the public and are systems that serve as original sources of data within the county.  This catalog will be reviewed and updated in July of each year.
columns_name: General Description of Categories or Types of Data
columns_description: This is the agency or department that maintains this system.
